oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Tennessee Farmer" reports Agricultural Society in Middle Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture
Agriculture; Periodicals; Horticulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Article appearing under the title of "Agricultural Society in Middle Tennessee" in the May 1, 1838, issue of the "Tennessee Farmer" conveys the importance of not only agricultural organization on the county level, but on the state level as well.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Emmerson, Thomas, 1773-1837, Deaderick, J.F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The "Tennessee Farmer" began operation in 1834 as the first monthly in Tennessee dedicated specifically to the promotion of agriculture. The publication's first editor, Judge Thomas Emmerson, and prominent Jonesborough merchant, David A. Deaderick, are credited with introducing the first cast iron plow into East Tennessee in 1825. Thomas Emmerson distingushed himself during his lifetime as a jurist, an editor, a mayor, a businessman and a patron of education and agriculture.
